website_summaries.verdict: This rack is designed to hang over your kitchen island. It looks beautiful and keeps those pots and utensils handy.
pros: Very good quality and design for the price
Mounts at four points for increased stability
Adjustable chains let you set the height that's best for you
Screened top also gives you space to store your stock pots with lids
cons: While there is a lot of space on this rack, it would be possible to overload it on weight
It is only designed to hold up to 40 pounds

customer_reviews.title: 2 person job
customer_reviews.text: (Requires a drill , 5/32" drill bit) not included. Easy to install just find the studs/ beams located in the ceiling. Recommend using a stud finder. Once you find the area you would like to hang this from just drill 4 holes With 5 /32" or (4,0mm) Drill bit. Then simply twist the hanging screws by hand. Fun little project. I did it myself and I have little experience using tools. If you find this review helpful please click the helpful button found below -Amazon man
customer_reviews.author: Amazonman

customer_reviews.title: Go ahead and buy it, it’s worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this pot rack. I couldn’t be more pleased. It might be my favorite kitchen accessory I’ve ever bought. Ever. It’s worth the money, without a doubt. I’ve saved so much cabinet storage space by being able to utilize otherwise empty space in my kitchen. I did buy a pack of extra hooks. I can’t speak to the difficulty of installing it. I had my (very handy engineer degree having) brother in law come do it for me since he had the tools and know how already. I don’t think he had any trouble at all. I’ve put more than pictured on the rack and it’s shown no signs of being overloaded. It’s very stable and very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Enriquez

customer_reviews.title: Damaged upon opening unable to use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to install after finished remodel opened the box and severely damaged and unable to return. Do not purchase until ready to open and install. Improper packaging to small of box allowing for damag.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!!! If your looking, get this one
customer_reviews.text: Awsome pot rack. Sturdy build and great look for the price. Install was strait forward and didn't take long at all. It hold all of my pots pans and lids balanced with no problem. I ended up buying 4 ceiling mount light fixture covers (pictures) to make the install a bit neater looking. If I had more pots I would buy another one. Good buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Derrick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pan rack at the cabin
customer_reviews.text: For the price paid the rack is nice. I notice that it does fluctuate in price quite a bit on Amazon. Personally I would have preferred black chain with the set, but I can change that easy enough. I got this as a space saver in a weekend cabin. It works great for my purpose. For my purpose I didn't need a $200 rack to impress anyone. I'm hanging a full set of pots and quite a few utensils, plus all the lids up top. If I was ordering again I would add some black chain and more hooks. I ended up buying more hooks as soon as it arrived. I had no quality issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: jachansen

customer_reviews.title: Clears out a lot of cabinet space
customer_reviews.text: I really like it as it cleared out cabinets and organized pots and pans and by hanging it, its convenient for me. It arrived complete with all the wood threaded eye bolts and hangers and was packaged well enough to prevent damage to the unit. I have high ceilings so had to add a little chain to get it to where I wanted it and was good enough quality for me. I have it loaded and used the hardware provided and feel confident it will hold as I did fasten into joist. I did feel it was a bit pricey but everything else is as well these days. I'm buying another for my son for bday.
customer_reviews.author: dave b

customer_reviews.title: Don’t second guess...buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy easy to put up once you find studs. I followed what the one reviewer did with ceiling to hide the hooks more. But I used 4 inch medallions. I have tall 9-10 feet ceilings and this is over an island. I love it. I originally thought it would be too much in your face but it’s great. Gives kitchen more character. I have lots of solid pans. I cook a lot. Love the easy access. Gives me more room for my appliances.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 25 Year Warranty, Cast Iron Hanger❣️
customer_reviews.text: I had saved a different ceiling pot hanger, for weeks & as it got closer to date for move I went on Amazon to order, but only to find a higher rated & priced lower item that has surpassed my expectations and I’m now officially in the ‘Hanging cast iron pot & pan hanger’ exclusive club. In Alaska, these sell for $200 min so when I ordered mine, got Prime shipping (free) and it arrived, it’s the first thing you see when entering the kitchen, along w/ my spectacular stainless steel pot/pan collection. This is one of the best investments of my life & w/ the 25 year warranty, my kids will inherit it. Thank you, Amazon❣️
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: great addition
customer_reviews.text: This item is a great addition to our kitchen. I was able to install the mounting hooks by myself and hang it as well. I ordered extra hooks to accommodate extra pans and utensils and they all fit nicely. The rack makes it easier to grab a pan or utensil for use and is within reach of the stove. The product is well made and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: supermex

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: I had to make some modifications to the chains since the available studs at my house wouldn't allow me to center it right where I wanted. I also didn't want to go into the attic to add supports because of the insulation. I added extra hooks and so far it's been holding up just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Diego Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This rack works as described and holds ( so far) a lot of pots and pans, only issue was my ceiling joist’s didn’t quite match up to make it look right so I built what I call a “ Ceiling Island” in order to make the chains hang right and distribute the weight evenly, I stains the ceiling island to match the kitchen and if I don’t say so myself, it looks Great!!! Love this thing, we’re very happy to this point.
customer_reviews.author: GeeWy

customer_reviews.title: Good once you replace the parts
customer_reviews.text: Unless you are lucky enough to have beams in the ceiling to install the unit, you will have to go and purchase your own installation ceiling hooks. With this I purchased new chains because the ones that come with the unit were too short and only hold like 40lbs. After purchasing new chains and strong drywall hooks, the unit works great.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: it has been a fantastic addition to our kitchen and keeps the cupboards free ...
customer_reviews.text: Marking the spots for the holes is the hardest part. Once that was done, installation was a breeze. If I had one complaint it would be that the chains are silver and don't match the darker metal and darker hooks. Other than that, it has been a fantastic addition to our kitchen and keeps the cupboards free for other stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Sean M. Moran

customer_reviews.title: Great for storing oversized (skewers, tongs), child-unfriendly items (kitchen shears, corkscrews), and stand mixer attachments.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to hang sharp or pointed utensils such as kitchen shears, corkscrews, blades for my food processor, skewers, vegetable peelers, pizza cutter, garlic press, pastry cutter, etc. so that any children who visit can't get to them. (I've most children can open "childproof" drawers by the time they can stand up on their own.) The rack hangs over my stand mixer, so I keep my mixer attachments on it as well, along with bundt cake pans, my sharpest knives, and oversize BBQ tongs. It's a great catch-all for oversized items. Someday, I may actually hang a pot on it!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Return but no refund
customer_reviews.text: Returned my items but no refund issued. This item is not properly advertised. Small and not very well designed.
customer_reviews.author: Melody

customer_reviews.title: Short Chains and Hard to hang
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the product is sturdy enough. My biggest issue is it was hard to assemble and hang and the chains were too short for an average home. I had to purchase additional chains to lengthen so I could actually reach my pots and pans.
customer_reviews.author: Kirkdiggler

customer_reviews.title: Strong and looks good
customer_reviews.text: I’ve wanted a pot rack for more than 10 years. The problem was a vaulted ceiling however it doesn’t hurt to have a skillful talented husband who finally built 2 beams to support the pot rack. The pot rack is exactly what I needed to free some clutter from stove top. The rack is strong and looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Craig

customer_reviews.title: Nice rack
customer_reviews.text: Nice rack. I wish the specs were a bit better for the load capacity. I got stronger hooks and will get a little stronger chain as well but that just personal preference. In the photo it's holding an 8qt pot, two 10" and 8" skillets, a 3qt, 2.5qt, 1.5qt sauce pans, and a sauce pan. I'm not sure I want to add the cast iron at this point but we'll see.
customer_reviews.author: Noodle

customer_reviews.title: Just beautiful
customer_reviews.text: I needed something for my All Clad cookware and this was just the ticket! Strong, sturdy, simple to hang, and very esthetically beautiful! Kudos to these guys for this product. I’d recommend this to anyone wanting a more beautiful kitchen
customer_reviews.author: Brian Mayfield

customer_reviews.title: I like it. Everything is as advertised
customer_reviews.text: There are two reasons this rack is not getting five stars. 1) The chains supplied with the black rack are stainless steel and do not match and 2) In all the photos I had seen of the rack, there were aesthetic medallions covering the ceiling hooks that apparently do not come with the rack. I see now that I am giving the review, the photos have changed. There are no photos showing the rack attached to the ceiling. Otherwise, I like it. Everything is as advertised, the rack is sturdy enough to handle a lot of pots and pans if hung correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Sisco

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: Just put it up a few hours ago. I'll update if it falls apart or breaks. Of course if it falls from the ceiling that's on me but so far the chains and hooks it came with are nice and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: MISS V

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Where to start? Frustration free packaging. Install was super easy. The center section measures 17in x 16in, with 16in being the exact distance between my ceiling joists. From opening the box to hanging pots was maybe 30 minutes. The directions don't say, but the ceiling hooks used a 1/4in pilot hole. Maybe drill a test hole in a scrap price of 2x4 or something to be sure. You can always make a bigger hole; I just remember it was definitely bigger than 1/8in.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Just what i was looking for
customer_reviews.text: This made my kitchen look so nice!!! It is very useful if you have limited cupboard space for pots and pans. I will say that you have to make sure to balance stuff on this correctly because it is held up a a chain so if one side has a lot of heavy stuff and the other doesn't, it will tip towards the heavy side so be aware of that. It was fairly easy to hang and has lots of hooks for utensils or pots and pans. Great product for a great price!!
customer_reviews.author: Athena

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to our kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. It helped free up cabinet space and I don’t have to sift through tons of pots and pans to find what I need. Great value and aesthetically pleasing. Fast shipping and pretty easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Chandra

customer_reviews.title: Could use a little extra chain
customer_reviews.text: I took one star off because I fell like there could be longer chains. I know my ceiling is extra high so I ended up spending $15 for extra chain. So maybe check your ceiling night and make sure you’re going to have enough. Other than that, we love it. It looks great and does hold a ton of stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Wish I bought sooner!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this!!!! My friend suggested that I get one for my apartment because I have so many pots and pans. He helped me find the studs in the ceiling and it is very sturdy and I throw almost everything up there
customer_reviews.author: Laura Delgado

customer_reviews.title: Not a high-end product, but great for the price
customer_reviews.text: My wife has an expensive ($300+) stainless steel pot rack in the kitchen. We are selling the house and she didn't want to leave it behind. The realtor said it would be a good selling point. So we looked for another pot rack and came across this one. Ordered it on the spot and it arrived promptly. It's more flimsy than her other one but for the price, you can't ask for much more. Installation was a breeze as I used the existing mounting screws from the old pot rack. It looks great as our appliances and countertops are black so it matches well. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a basic pot rack.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. ThenTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: We installed this over our kitchen island using the ceiling studs as mounting points. Be patient and use a square to ensure equal spacing and proper alignment of the four mounting hooks; and go through the effort to pre-drill and mount in the studs and you'll never have to worry about how much weight you put on the shelf, it'll handle what you can fit on it. I recommend buying additional "S" hooks depending if you are planning of hanging a lot of items from it (I did). It looks great, would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: R. Burger

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen rack!
customer_reviews.text: I have many pots and pans and no room to store them - this thing is a game changer. Now all my pots and pans are hanging above my island. Life is good. Oh also, the install was very simple - once you locate the studs - I have a heavily textured ceiling - so I used neodymium magnets to search out all the nails/screws to find the studs. I found the magnets at a local hardware store, I'm sure amazon has them also. Edit: 11/2/14 - This thing is such a steal - I've had so many positive comments on it. I really just meant for it to save space, I'm glad it's also impressive looking.
customer_reviews.author: S King

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to a kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This was conveniently packed, easy to install and looks great. Took about an hour to hang. Wonderful for giving extra storage in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Norman

customer_reviews.title: Love this was easy to install and took my kitchen ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this was easy to install and took my kitchen to such a beautiful modern look. Very well built I highly recommend this if you are looking for a pot and pan rack. Took advice from the other reviews and ordered extra hooks at time of purchase. If you go with the black the wire support in middle is chrome and the chains are chrome hooks are black. Just in case you need to know
customer_reviews.author: shelly druzbicki

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I use this to hang all my pans and utensils on. It's really stout too. I have 3 heavy cast iron skillets that I hang on this and it hasn't budged. Just make sure that when you hang it that you put the screws in solid wood. Sheet rock WILL NOT hold this thing when loaded.
customer_reviews.author: Danny B.

customer_reviews.title: Really nice rack for pots and pans
customer_reviews.text: Really nice rack for pots and pans. It really didn’t come with enough hooks. A little difficult to assemble but once it’s up it looked really great
customer_reviews.author: e han

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Pot Rack, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Nice sized pot rack fit perfectly over my new sink. I didn't like the chrome chain that came with it so I ended up getting different chain as I wanted black. I found some decorative chain at home depot that holds 35 lbs per length. Since it was 3' long and I only needed 8" per side it was fine. The hooks that come with the pot rack work fine but they are loose so it made it difficult to remove pots and pans without the hooks falling off. A small dab of clear silicon on the top part of the included "S" hooks keeps them in place. All in all, a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: My Real Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Great pot hanger! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it only thing is we have low ceilings and I have stainless steel pans that hang down long and my husband insist on walking thru them instead of around it!! So he bumps his head! But it's very sturdy, doesn't look cheap, I love the rack in the middle as I hang all my long handled utensils on it. My beautiful pits and pans get to show off! It got here super quick too. Pretty easy to put up hardest part for my husband was finding the studs.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Space Saver
customer_reviews.text: Our kitchen really lacks adequate storage but this pot rack has really made our kitchen work. The rack itself looks great and is made very sturdy. If you can screw into a floor joist this thing can hold a ton of weight. We have a set of cast iron skillets hanging from it, plus our pots and other kitchen stuff. Another great feature is that the square rack in the middle basically doubles as a shelf. You can store stuff above the rack as well. Also, because it hangs from chains, you can basically adjust it to whatever height you like.
customer_reviews.author: Buddhagem

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Super inexpensive and easy to hang. Holds ALL my big pans and freed up tons of cabinet space. I hung it without chains so it hugs the ceiling. Plus, for the price you'd think it was cheap but its not. Has a 25yr warranty. Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: hampshire

customer_reviews.title: pots pots and pots
customer_reviews.text: if you hate losing storage space and bending over digging through a pile of pots in the cabinet then this is what you need. its basic and it works.
customer_reviews.author: Lygerr

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation!
customer_reviews.text: Love how easy it was to install this and to use it! Came with more than enough hooks (and space for more to be added if needed) and I do not care about the mixed colors (black item and hooks with silver chains and grid shelf). I purchased this item over others I researched because I liked that it attached to the ceiling in four places rather than only two, as it seemed like it would be steadier. It barely moves when adding/removing pans and the added shelf in the middle holds my bulky stock pot. This freed up much needed cabinet space for other items!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Best Kitchen Accessory EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: It took a full year for us to get around to finding the right spot for this and putting it up. Now, every time my kids come home, they look up at it, and into the nice, organized cupboards and ask, "Why did it take us so long to get one of these?" My pans aren't pretty; most are over 40 years old and well-worn, but I love their easy accessibility. It makes the kitchen feel more like home.
customer_reviews.author: Kjirstin Youngberg

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I could not have purchased a better product for the price.. I was shocked that it was a beautiful and sturdy as on picture
customer_reviews.author: rorens

customer_reviews.title: Can't be beat for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This thing looks fantastic- I hung it up over a week ago and every single person who's been in my house since then has commented on how great it looks and asked where I got it. One friend has already ordered one like mine. As stated by other commenters, the chains are a little flimsy, but for less than $40, what do you expect? Go to a hardware store and buy sturdier chains if you need this to support more than 40 pounds. It hangs my two sets of stainless steel pots/pans just fine. And it's opened up SO much space in my kitchen as well as become a bit of a conversation centerpeice! I LOVE it.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Sutherland

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: love, love, love this item. I'm 4'11 and I installed this easily by myself. Great quality! Looks more expensive than I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. Has been hanging in the kitchen for ...
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Has been hanging in the kitchen for about 6 months. Plenty of hooks, and seems to hold a decent amount of weight.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Buckley

customer_reviews.title: Great product!! Great Price!!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical about buying this pot rack because like the old saying goes you usually get what you pay for and this pot rack is extremly cheap in price compared to many of the others out there. But once it arrived I was pleasantly surprised, its very durable, looks very nice and was easy to hang.. I have many heavy pots and pans (I'm actually over the limit in weight it recommends) and have had no problems whatsoever, of course make sure you hang the hooks in a joist (wood), do not take shortcuts and anchor into plaster or drywall, I would recommend this to anyone looking for a pot rack..
customer_reviews.author: Usernameunknown

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I wish it had a few more hooks, but I can get those at Home Depot. My husband installed it easily, took him a minute to find studs to hang from and they weren't exactly where I wasnted it but it'd rather it not fall out. especially since the pot/pan set I have is made out of extremely thick stainless steel and is heavy with everything on it. The top grate has some baking dishes on it, but i'll probably never grab them without standing on a chair. It may just be easier to use it for decoration (fake plants) since I'll never be able to reach it.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany S

customer_reviews.title: Great Rack - Lots of compliments
customer_reviews.text: I had just bought a new set of anodized pans, and did not want to ruin them by stacking them in a cabinet. I looked at racks at department stores and many kitchen stores and outlets nearby. I was shocked at how expensive many of them were. At this price, I was concerned this rack would be poor quality. Well, my worry was for naught. This rack is sturdy, well made, and easy to install. It looks great in my kitchen. I have gotten more compliments about this rack than anything else I have done to the kitchen (even a total remodel).
customer_reviews.author: T. Scanlon

customer_reviews.title: Great for kitchen, but use a stud finder first
customer_reviews.text: I got lucky when I ordered this because we had studs in the proper place to hang it. The directions explicitly state that you MUST hang at least one or both sides from a ceiling stud. Overall, a great pot rack for the price!
customer_reviews.author: matt and tj

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to our kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE this rack! It provided so much storage and it looks great. We’re going to reinforce the hooks soon so they look a little nicer but otherwise it’s perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Latoya

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price- I wish I had bought ...
customer_reviews.text: I will add my five stars to all the others. Great value for the price- I wish I had bought it sooner! Another reviewer recommended the Cuisinart hooks, do get them, they work better for me, so do get them, too.
customer_reviews.author: Kismetmiao

customer_reviews.title: This is a pretty good pot rack
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good pot rack; it looks nice and feels sturdy. The product matches the pictures well and it comes with plenty of little hooks for hanging stuff off of, but nothing on this rack is "Wrought-Iron," as it is described. The price is good, however, so if you can live with the false description, it's not a bad way to spend money if you'd like to hang some kitchenware.
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for keeping pots and pans easy to reach
customer_reviews.text: I have bought two, one for me and then one for a friend because I love it so much. I have a bad back so digging in the bottom cabinets for pots and pans was a literal pain. This keeps them all in reach with the adjustable height. I'd buy a third if I had reason.
customer_reviews.author: Luna

customer_reviews.title: Best secondary shelve for your kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This was very quick to install. When you put it in the ceiling, make sure you screw it in to a joist, otherwise it will not hold. This rack has cleared out a lot of cabinet space for us and our kitchen didn’t have much.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremie Turner

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this! It makes it so easy to grab a pot, a pan, or a cooking utensil. I bought extra hanging hooks, so have quite a bit hanging from it. Also, it has freed up storage space, which I needed. Plus, I love the "personality" it added to the kitchen, great addition!
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: I would buy it again
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of room for all our pots and pans. The storage on top is great. Looks great in the kitchen. I wish the hooks were a little tighter and didn’t move as much but you get used to it. You could always bend em a bit if you wanted to. Overall for the price, we like it and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya I Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Easy to hang and easy to stock full of pots/pans
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what it's supposed to be! Easy to hang and easy to stock full of pots/pans. I wasn't able to land on studs so I used some drywall anchor hooks from walmart. I'm surprised at the weight this thing holds. In total it took me and my 12 year old son about 20 minutes to hang from ceiling including measuring. Very easy to install, holds a ton of pots and looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Smash Booth

customer_reviews.title: Wife loved this
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome value and defeinitely would reccommend to anyone. The only thing I would reccommend to the company is to look into a more modular mounting process. In my house the ceiling joists are on a 21" center vs standard 14/16" centers. This made for a tricky hanging but we were able to accomplish it. If there were multiple tabs to connect to along the entire product, I think mounting would have been much simpler.
customer_reviews.author: Nesto

customer_reviews.title: Great price, fast delivery!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this pot rack! It. The four chains that it hangs from makes it very sturdy, no tipping or swinging when you remove a pot. This has freed up much needed cabinet space, and it looks so good! I'm very happy with this purchase, the price was great and it was delivered several days ahead of date promised.
customer_reviews.author: Wanderer

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: This was a fantastic addition to my kitchen. Can’t believe I’ve waited so long to buy a pot rack like this. It has freed up so much space. I would buy this again in a heart beat!
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Looks great! Holds everything nicely, they give plenty of chain to use. The instructions were simple enough but my only complaint is they don't provide anchors. Also if they could have provided a template to drill holes I think that could have made the job so easy .
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Great prize and quality
customer_reviews.text: Great material and great price, local stores were asking 200% more for a smaller size one. I would say I made a great purchase and so should you.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive but looks beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a pot rack with a sharp appearance, but not a big price, this is it! I love my Cuisinart GRUH-6 Universal pot rack! It was inexpensive yet looks great! It currently is holding 12 pans and pots, 1 stainless steel large colandar, three bundles of picked herbs (for looks) and yet there is room for more! Very sturdy and looks great! What can I say? I love all of Cuisinart products! The inexpensive price on this one frightened me, but I went for it and am 100% happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Robin Yule

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Product 25 year guarantee.
customer_reviews.text: Needed something to fit my kitchen and this rack fit the bill! I screwed it right into the ceiling joists and it is as strong as a rock. I store 5 copper chef pans and lids hanging on it at a time, and one large pan which is on the top rack. Comes with all hardware, ready to hang. Ordered more hooks to hang my utensils plenty of room. Highly recommend this product! Thanks, great price too...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fancy cook
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always wanted one of these and after buying our first house we got one and it’s so useful. Frees up a lot of space in the kitchen cabinets. Easy to install too.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put up. I have 9.5 ft ceilings so it hangs at the perfect height. Very easy to assemble too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pot rack for our needs.Quality control needs to be better though.
customer_reviews.text: We love the way it looks and it was easy to hang, I was able to do it myself without assistance, though it would have been easier with another person. The only negative thing I can say is that ours came with a not completely welded side, hope it will not effect it's strength it was a very sturdy feeling joint so we ended up keeping it as shipping it back would have been costly. So far so good. Though there should really be better quality control we really do feel that for the money it is a great pot rack!
customer_reviews.author: entropy

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great definitely added more room to my cupboards after setting this up!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful piece and very easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I have stored my new set of cookware (and lids) on the hooks provided. Perfect amount of hooks are included in the kit, and all hardware too. I absolutely love this and would recommend. I have a galley kitchen and pots with lids get a little bit much for the cabinet space. The look is awesome and I am so glad I did it.
customer_reviews.author: skinny

customer_reviews.title: Space saver
customer_reviews.text: I have limited cupboard space and when I purchased my new Calphalon pans I didn't want them nesting inside each other getting scratched, so I decided to purchase a pan rack, nice looking and very sturdy, looks great in my kitchen which is stainless steel and black, holds all my new pans with ease and lids all store on top, even have room for a few other gadgets that are used often. You won't be disappointed in this item
customer_reviews.author: Sassie Girl

customer_reviews.title: It does what it's designed to do, and does it well. Can't ask for much more than that. Buy this, it's great!
customer_reviews.text: I love my pot rack. Loves ma pot rack. Just make sure to secure this thing to actual ceiling studs, which can be difficult in some instances. I have a 10 pound cast iron skillet that hangs from this and I'm not worried at all. Like a rack! I love pot racks because they free up cabinet space! If you live in a tiny space with a tiny kitchen, do yourself a solid and buy one of these and hang all your pots and pans from it. You won't be sorry!
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey A. Sergeant

customer_reviews.title: after spending $$$ on remodeling our kitchen THIS Is what everyone notices
customer_reviews.text: we tore down walls, we put granite on our counter tops, new fridge, dishwasher, backslash. Tons of man hours and money spent, and for some odd reason, people tend to notice this rack hanging over our counter top. On top of that it was easy to install once I was able to find a few studs and put on some strong 100lb anchors. Either way, I'm happy with the purchase and glad I was able to install it fairly easily. For the amount of $ it costs it's a steel....steal.
customer_reviews.author: Bubbles-Desmo

customer_reviews.title: Wife is happy
customer_reviews.text: Works great and wife is happy with the looks and function
customer_reviews.author: Robert Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Should be in every kitchen - love it
customer_reviews.text: Love our pot rack. It looks awesome and has enough space for all my pots, pans and cooking utensils. I purchased additional hooks since the included once were not enough. I can only recommend it since it adds visual design to you kitchen and frees space in your cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: EwaT

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with a broken weld.
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived ahead of estimated time of delivery. However, when I opened the box, one of the welds was broken. Not a very good quality item. Don’t waste your money. Pay more for a higher end product.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Camarata

customer_reviews.title: Great Inexpensive Simplistic Pot Rack
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this rack to showcase my Kitchenaid Pots and it is great at that. It is a very simplistic design - fading into the background while my pots are on center stage. I added a vintage looking Bakery sign to hide the rack even further. The design is great and it was a snap to install.
customer_reviews.author: Elainep

customer_reviews.title: Great item to purchase
customer_reviews.text: This pot rack has been great. We have several larger pots hanging from this. Very reliable and sturdy. Black finish is nice. Could supply more hooks, but you can easily get these from a local hardware store. Would recommend getting thicker chains to hang.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Strong and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I am definitely a fan of this product .We have a small kitchen and I think it is perfect ! I think it would go great in a bigger kitchen too.Definitely a fan of this!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Great Price for Quality and Performance
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pot rack like that that we purchased, and the price is very reasonable for the quality of the rack. It is very sturdy, and supports quite a few pans at once, if you need to make room in cabinets and drawers. We left our first rack in the house we just sold, and found we needed another when we moved. Since the price seems great for quality performance, we bought the same kind again. Highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Cmartcookie

customer_reviews.title: Shipped fast and was very easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Shipped fast and was very easy to install. It looks beautiful above our island and I was really happy with the price. My favorite part is that it's pretty light weight. I'm 5ft 6, 125lbs and I had no problem installing this. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. My husband hung it up in about 20 minutes and I'm loving it
customer_reviews.author: C Lee

customer_reviews.title: This is a great pot rack for a very
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pot rack for a very, very reasonable price. I initially had some hesitations putting my 15 pound oversize cast iron pan on it, but after screwing the hooks into studs on the ceiling and testing the rack with my weight, I had no qualms. The weakest link will always be where it is attached to the ceiling - the rest of the rack is quite sturdy. It made my kitchen much less cluttered and utilized previously empty space. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Joe M.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It really helped free up cabinet space in our small kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Fregoso

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great! A little wobbly, but over all a great addition to our kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Starr

customer_reviews.title: good function. I hang about 10 pans and about ...
customer_reviews.text: Price was right, good function. I hang about 10 pans and about 4 lids on top rack. Very useful...looks good with utensils. Make sure you use anchors (metal spring loaded) if not using studs to hang. May have to patch holes with anchors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I love this pan rack. It works great and was easy to put together. Very sturdy and great price!
customer_reviews.author: LauraM

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Once I found the studs in the ceiling
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Once I found the studs in the ceiling, this was very easy to put up and holds a lot! I used the hooks given and haven't had an issue with them being too flimsy (as some have alluded). I have probably about 20 pots/pans/strainers hung up.
customer_reviews.author: k_skies

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful! It holds my black iron skillets and other ...
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful! It holds my black iron skillets and other pots and pans which helped clean up the clutter in my bottom cabinet. Hubby installed it while I was at the office but said the installation was easy. It is very well made and very sturdy. I had been wanting one of these for several years but thought they would be out of my price range. When I found this one I was excited and when it arrived I was very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: C.F. Wentworth

customer_reviews.title: Great pot rack for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Always wanted a pot rack for my pots & pans that I mostly used daily. Since living in an apartment, storage place is pretty limited. I priced a lot of different pot racks at cooking supply stores & the internet. Obviously, the prices at those stores were well beyond my means ($200-300). So when I saw this one on Amazon for about $38 + S/H, I thought this would be fairly cheaply made. But when I received it, I was very surprise to see that it was pretty well made! Can't beat this rack for the price plus it comes with 12 sturdy hooks to boot!
customer_reviews.author: whobejuan

customer_reviews.title: Could not be happier with this pot rack.
customer_reviews.text: I love this pot rack. Assuming you get the hooks in to studs in the ceiling you can really load this rack down. I have it jammed packed with pots, pans, and accessories and have had no problems. It holds more than you would think it would. Great buy for the money and competes well with more expensive alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Banneck

customer_reviews.title: Very nice pots and pans rack
customer_reviews.text: Just make sure you are screwing the hooks into the studs in the ceiling and you will be golden. It holds all my pots and pans without issue. It's very straightforward on assembly and installation. Just make sure you have a stud finder so you dont end up with holes in your ceiling
customer_reviews.author: Derek G.

customer_reviews.title: And it looks COOL!!
customer_reviews.text: As long as you are capable of finding the joists in your ceiling, and know how to use a drill, measuring tape, stud finder, and a pencil, you'll be able to free up a lot of space in your kitchen. And it looks COOL!!!
customer_reviews.author: PapaBear

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price. far less than the others and does the job well.
customer_reviews.text: Nice for the price and holds even my iron skillets. Of course, I made it hang very securely with beefed up ceiling bolts. For the price, get one if this is what you are after. I need more hooks though. It would be nice if they were offered as additional items for purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Monkey

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: Item came in fine condition and just as pictured. My only advice is to be caution of what you are suspending from, being sure that you are hitting studs and not just trying to hang this thing from the drywall on the ceiling. This held 2 saucepans, frying pan, and two stock pots plus an assortment of utensils easily. On top we fit the food sealer and all of it's accessories and it could have handled more weight I'm sure.
customer_reviews.author: Laurennn

customer_reviews.title: Wife hated it at first
customer_reviews.text: Wife hated it at first, but it is extremely functional. We have no less than 14 HEAVY Calphalon pots and pans hanging from this (anchored into joists) and it is still holding about a year later.
customer_reviews.author: J. Garland

customer_reviews.title: I love this pot rack!
customer_reviews.text: After looking around several times and for a long time, I decided to take a chance on this pot rack. I just have one word: Amazing! I love this pot rack, it looks beautiful in my kitchen, installation was pretty quick and easy, it's exactly what I was looking for and the price couldn't be better. Complete accesories, 12 hooks enough for me, beutiful design, I can recommend this product without any doubts.
customer_reviews.author: GETC

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install, has been used heavily for months and seems very sturdy. The shelf on the top is large enough to hold my biggest roasting pan. I put it above the kitchen table and it is easy to reach yet still have plenty of headroom. This has freed up so much space in the kitchen plus I can see what I am looking for. I looked at other racks that were several times the price and really feel that this was the perfect choice for my small kitchen, solid unit at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: jean steinman

customer_reviews.title: This product is the best I have tried
customer_reviews.text: This product is the best I have tried, of any brand. It worked perfectly from the get go. I have had no problems with the product and would highly recommend it to anyone who loves an excellent value. It is built to last and is efficient as it out performs all other products like it. You won’t regret this purchase. This product gets top ratings 5★s
customer_reviews.author: SamBamSr

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the condition and look of the item
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the condition and look of the item, but am in a pickle about mounting it... It would seem that my ceiling has virtually no joists... Not sure how it is possible, but they seem to be space unevenly some even stopping in the middle of the ceiling. Looking into what mounts I can use with such large mounting hooks
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: I love this pot rack
customer_reviews.text: I love this pot rack, it helped make my tiny kitchen function better, cleared up a cabinet so I could move my trash can out of the very small walkway. It hangs over my sink and makes drying pots and pans a breeze. It was easy to install as well.
customer_reviews.author: Paris

customer_reviews.title: made life easier
customer_reviews.text: This really made life easier in our kitchen. Getting down to the lower cabinets was getting painful in the knees and back. This is so much more convenient. Looks good too. If it was 10 or 12 inches longer, I would have given it a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: C E. Grif

product_meta.title: Kinetic Pot, Black with Silver Rack
product_meta.description: Color:Black with Silver RackClassicor oval wrought iron ceiling mount pot rack holds 40 lbs. The rack measuring 33x17x1.5-in includes four ceiling hooks, four 22 inch lengths of chain, four S hooks, twelve pot hooks for installation into the ceiling joists. Wrought-iron construction is attractive and durable. The heavy-gauge removable center grid holds additional hooks. 25 year limited warranty.
feature_bullets: Oval ceiling mount pot rack adds style and charm to any kitchen. Wrought-iron construction is attractive and durable
Rack measures 33 x 17 x 1.5 inches,Hook Height:3.25inches,Clearance from Floor:22inches,Clearance to Ceiling:22inches
Removable center grid holds additional hooks
Includes four ceiling hooks, four 22 inch lengths of chain, four S hooks, twelve pot hooks
Removable center grid holds additional hooks
Includes four ceiling hooks, four 22 inch lengths of chain, four S hooks, twelve pot hooks
